cards.flavor:

Flying

Flash

“Always in the light, Heliod's shrines are on the highest peaks or the tallest hills.”
—Nykthos, Architect of Gods

“I was seized by inspiration one night. I worked feverishly for a week, then a month, to ensure this temple's absolute perfection.”

“Karametra is god of agriculture. But the wilds, from humble seed to mighty oak, belong to Nylea alone.”

cards.flavor:
“Snake-twined Pharika, mother of gorgons, I beseech you, show me what invigorates and what envenoms in this place.”

cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, up to one target creature or Shrine gains deathtouch until end of turn. If you control three or more Shrines, other creatures you control also gain deathtouch until end of turn.

cards.flavor: No one will admit that they visit the lead idol, strung wit coins and shrouded in silk. But yet, each night the candles are lit fresh and the bowl heavy with new offerings.

cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, each opponent mills two cards. If you control three or more Shrines, scry 2.

“From the Siren Sea to a lonely cup of stew, Thassa controls the waters of all of Theros.”
—Nykthos, Architect of Gods
